Functions.c

00001 // POB-Technology 2009
00002 //
00003 // File : Functions.c
00004 // Author : Foucault Alisson
00005 //
00006 // This file includes functions such as Pob-proto initialization and printing on LCD screen   
00007 //
00008 
00009 #include <pob-eye.h>
00010 #include <stdlib.h>
00011 #include "pad.h"
00012 #include "math.h"
00013 #include "bitmap.h"
00014 
00015 // This initialize the PobProto
00016 void InitPobProto (void)
00017 {
00018         PobProto        Proto; // struct to set the pob-proto
00019         
00020         Proto.porta=ALL_PORTA_AS_ANA;   //to get the position of the analogic joystick, you have to set the PORTA as analogic input
00021         Proto.portc=RC7_AS_DO| RC6_AS_DO |RC3_AS_DO |RC2_AS_SERVO|RC1_AS_SERVO |RC0_AS_SERVO;   //all pin of PORTC are configured to manage servomotors
00022         Proto.portd=RD7_AS_DI   | RD6_AS_DI     |RD5_AS_DI |RD4_AS_DI|RD3_AS_DO |RD2_AS_DO      |RD1_AS_DO      |RD0_AS_DO;             //RD0 RD1 RD2 RD3 are configured as digitals output to gear DC motor, RD4 RD5 RD6 RD7 are configured as digitals input
00023         SetPobProto(&Proto);    //set the pob proto
00024 }
00025 
00026 //array for display the graphic interface
00027 static GraphicBuffer LCD_Buffer_Video;
00028 static UInt8         LCD_Buffer[LCD_WIDTH*LCD_HEIGHT*BITS];
00029 static UInt8             ASCII_Buffer[LCD_WIDTH*LCD_HEIGHT*BITS]; // Buffer to stock the ascii table in bitmap format
00030 
00031 // Set the bitmap  picture of the first 127 ASCII Char in ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER
00032 // ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER will be used to get the pictures of characters to display on the LCD
00033 
00034 void InitAsciiBuffer() 
00035 {
00036         GraphicBuffer ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER;
00037         
00038         InitGraphicBuffer(&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER,LCD_WIDTH,LCD_HEIGHT,ONE_BIT,ASCII_Buffer); 
00039         ClearGraphicBuffer(&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER);
00040         DrawBitmap(0,0, IDB_ASCII,bitmap,&ASCII_GRAPHIC_BUFFER); //bitmap is an array built by pob-tools
00041 }
00042         
00043 /****************************************************************************************************************************
00044 * PrintTextOnPobLCD : displays a string in the screen buffer
00045 *
00046 * row : LCD display Row of the first char
00047 * col :  LCD display column of the first char
00048 * string : string to display, Use 'sprintf' function to build a string including floats and intergers
00049 * Screen_Bufffer : Screen buffer to display
00050 *
00051 * ASCII_Buffer is the buffer oh the fisrt 127 chars of the ASCII table. Each char is 8x8 pixels, it is possible to display 16 char per row and 8 columns
00052 *****************************************************************************************************************************/
00053 
00054 void PrintTextOnPobLCD(int row, int col, char *string, UInt8 *Screen_Buffer)
00055 {
00056         int i,j,k=0; // i = ascii char starting buffer; j = 0 to 7 (8 times 8 points)
00057 
00058 while(*string) 
00059         {
00060                 // starting point in the ASCII_Buffer of the char to display,128 (16charx8lines of pixels) is a complete row of text
00061                 i = (string[0]/16)*128 + (string[0]%16);        
00062         // display char on Screen_Buffer, 8 bytes
00063         for (j=0; j<8; j++) 
00064                 {               
00065                 // 8 intergers to define a bitmap of a char
00066                 Screen_Buffer[col+row*128+k*16]=ASCII_Buffer[i+j*16];
00067                 k++;
00068                 }
00069         string++;       
00070         k=0;
00071         // 1 byte right
00072         col+=1;                                         
00073         if (col%16==0) 
00074                 {                       
00075                 // Manages end of line and go to the next line on the left
00076                 row++; 
00077                 col=0;
00078                         // Go to the top of the screen if the bottom is reached
00079                         if (row%8 == 0)         row=0;  
00080                 }
00081         }
00082 }
